LanguageData.RFR.ruinsLevel: Density of Ruins on New Maps:
LanguageData.RFR.RuinsNone: No ruins at all! A pristine landscape.
LanguageData.RFR.RuinsVeryLow: Very low density. Few, if any, ruins present.
LanguageData.RFR.RuinsInsane: Insanely high density. Possibly more "inside" than "outside."
LanguageData.RFR.RuinsRandom: RANDOM. Each time a map is created, a setting will be selected randomly.
LanguageData.RFR.shrinesLevel: Density of "Ancient Shrines" on New Maps:
LanguageData.RFR.ShrinesNone: Absolutely no shrines to be found.
LanguageData.RFR.ShrinesVeryLow: Very low density. Few shrines. Perhaps even none at all.
LanguageData.RFR.ShrinesInsane: Insanely high density. "Ancient dangers" are everywhere!
LanguageData.RFR.ShrinesRandom: RANDOM. Each time a map is created, a setting will be selected randomly.
LanguageData.RFR.stoneType: Stones Used in Shrines and Ruins:
LanguageData.RFR.StoneVanilla: Stone ruins will be constructed from random stone types. (This is vanilla behavior.)
LanguageData.RFR.StoneMixed: Most stone ruins will be constructed from "local" stone types (those available on the map).
LanguageData.RFR.StoneLocal: All stone ruins will be constructed from locally-available stone types.
LanguageData.RFR.StoneRandom: RANDOM. Each time a map is created, a setting will be selected randomly.
LanguageData.RFR.AnimalDensityDense: Dense. More animal life than usual.
LanguageData.RFR.AnimalDensityRandom: RANDOM. Each time a map is created, a setting will be selected randomly.
LanguageData.RFR.PlantDensityDense: Dense. More plant life than usual.
LanguageData.RFR.PlantDensityRandom: RANDOM. Each time a map is created, a setting will be selected randomly.
LanguageData.RFR.oreLevel: Density of Ore on New Maps:
LanguageData.RFR.OreNone: No ore at all. This of course makes the game more difficult.
LanguageData.RFR.OreVeryHigh: Very high ore density. (Four times normal.)
LanguageData.RFR.OreRandom: RANDOM. Each time a map is created, a setting will be selected randomly.
LanguageData.RFR.geysersLevel: Density of Geysers on New Maps:
LanguageData.RFR.GeysersNone: No geysers at all. No geothermal energy for you!
LanguageData.RFR.GeysersVeryHigh: Very high geyser density. (Four times normal.)
LanguageData.RFR.GeysersRandom: RANDOM. Each time a map is created, a setting will be selected randomly.
LanguageData.RFR.chunksLevel: Density of Stone Chunks on New Maps:
LanguageData.RFR.ChunksNone: No stone chunks at all. If you want stone, you'll have to mine it!
LanguageData.RFR.ChunksRandom: RANDOM. Each time a map is created, a setting will be selected randomly.
LanguageData.RFR.MountainVeryLow: Very low. Flat maps will have few (if any) outcroppings. Mountain maps will have large open spaces.
LanguageData.RFR.MountainInsane: Extreme. Flat maps will look much like vanilla mountain maps. Mountain maps may be nearly solid.
LanguageData.RFR.MountainRandom: RANDOM. Each time a map is created, a setting will be selected randomly.
LanguageData.RFR.WaterVeryLow: Very low water level. Lakes and marshes will be quite small.
LanguageData.RFR.WaterVeryHigh: Very high water level. Maps will likely feature large lakes or marshes.
LanguageData.RFR.WaterRandom: RANDOM. Each time a map is created, a setting will be selected randomly.
LanguageData.RFR.FertilityNone: Very low quantity of rich soil.
LanguageData.RFR.FertilityVeryHigh: Very high quantity of rich soil.
LanguageData.RFR.FertilityRandom: RANDOM. Each time a map is created, a setting will be selected randomly.
LanguageData.RFR.CoastNormal: Vanilla. A strip of ocean and some sand on one edge of the map.
LanguageData.RFR.CoastHigh1: A bit high. A larger strip of ocean and sand.
LanguageData.RFR.CoastHigh2: High. A much larger strip of ocean and sand than in vanilla.
LanguageData.RFR.CoastVeryHigh1: Very high. More ocean and a lot of beach.
LanguageData.RFR.CoastVeryHigh2: Even higher. Even more ocean. Even more sand. Even less useful land.
LanguageData.RFR.CoastVeryHigh3: Extremely high. Much of the map will consist of ocean water and sandbars.
LanguageData.RFR.CoastInsane: Insanely high. Good luck finding any dry land!
LanguageData.RFR.CoastRandom: RANDOM. Each time a map is created, a setting will be selected randomly.
LanguageData.RFR.DisallowIslandsTip: If this option is checked, no rock outcroppings will appear in oceans, lakes or marshes. Note that combining this option with a high water level can seriously reduce the amount of stone even on mountain maps.

LanguageData.RFR.AllowFakeOresTip: If this option is unchecked, compacted steel, plasteel and machinery will not appear on maps. This will of course make the game more difficult, but will allow you to create maps that look more natural, if you want to play on a world that seems truly untouched by prior habitation.
